post.title: Know it Well, Pharma/Biotech Marketers! In-depth 3-day Courses in Managed Markets, Segmentation & Market Research.
post.summary:
Managed Markets, Segmentation & Market Research! Know it Well! Know the Secrets! Comprehensive, in-depth and "no-holds-barred" training courses. More detail at PharmaCourses.com.
Upcoming training in 2011 includes courses on: * US Payers/Managed Care Strategic Planning & Execution for Pharma/Biotech. Aug 10-12 & Oct 5-7, 2011 * Segmentation & Targeting for Pharma/Biotech: Physician, Patient, Payer and Hospitals. Sep 7-9, 2011. * Marketing Research for "Real-life" Pharma/Biotech Decision Making. Nov 16-18,2011.
Excertps of testimonials at PharmaCourses.com: * "This is the most comprehensive managed care training course that I have seen…" Vice-President, Commercial Operations, Pharma Co. * "One of the best training classes I have ever taken. Excellent Value." Director, Health Economics, Pharma Co. * "…in-depth behind the scenes look …" Senior Manager, Market Research, Pharma Co. * "Valuable overview…" Director, Pricing, Pharma Co.
About the Institute of Pharmaceutical Management - The Institute provides comprehensive, pragmatic and unbiased training for pharmaceutical/biotech professionals and executives. Intensive courses are developed with input from pharmaceutical professionals with the goals of helping individuals become self-reliant and be the best at their jobs. More detail at PharmaCourses.com.
Please register soon to benefit from these courses and forward this e-mail to those who may benefit from them. Do also feel free to call me anytime at 267.907.9669 or e-mail SanjayBajpai@PharmaCourses.com.
Make it a great day!
Sanjay ---- Sanjay Bajpai President, Institute of Pharmaceutical Management PharmaCourses.com 267.907.9669 (O)

creator.headline: President, Institute of Pharmaceutical Management - Pharma Market Research, Market Access, Managed Markets & Health Econ

post.title: Is there a way to use Support Vector Machines with categorical predictor variables in R?
post.summary: I am facing a situation where I am trying to fit an SVM classification model in R. I have used the e1071 package before. But in this case, the predictiors are mostly categorical. 1. Can we fit an SVM using categorical predictors? 2. Is there a way to achieve this in R?

Appreciate your trouble and effort.
Thanks and Regards, Mudassar Ahmed
